div.head: CHAP. XII.
div.ab: Whoso loueth instruction, loueth knowledge: but he that hateth reproofe, is brutish.
A good man obtaineth fauour of the Lord: but a man of wicked deuices will he condemne.
A man shall not bee established by wickednesse: but the roote of the righteous shall not be mooued. Chap.10. 25.
A vertuous woman is a crowne to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed, is as rottennesse in his bones. 1.Cor. 11.7.
The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
The words of the wicked are to lie in waite for blood: but the mouth of the vpright shall deliuer them. Chap.1. 11. & 18.
The wicked are ouerthrowen, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand. Psal.37.37 prou.11.21.
A man shall be commended according to his wisedome: but hee that is of a peruerse heart, shall be despised. Heb. perverse of heart.
Hee that is despised and hath a seruant, is better then he that honoureth himselfe, and lacketh bread.
A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruell. Or, bowels.
Hee that tilleth his land, shall bee satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vaine persons, is void of vnderstanding. Chap.28. 19.
The wicked desireth the net of euill men: but the roote of the righteous yeeldeth fruit. Or, the fortresse.
The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lippes: but the iust shall come out of trouble. Heb. the snare of the wicked is in the transgression of lippes. , Cha.18.7.
A man shall bee satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, and the recompence of a mans hands shall bee rendred vnto him. Cha.13.2.
The way of a foole is right in his owne eyes: but he that hearkeneth vnto counsell, is wise. Chap.3.7.
A fooles wrath is presently knowen: but a prudent man couereth shame. Heb. in that day.
He that speaketh trueth, sheweth foorth righteousnesse: but a false witnesse, deceit. Cha.14.5.
There is that speaketh like the pearcings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health. Psal.57.5. & 59.8.
The lippe of trueth shall bee established for euer: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine euill: but to the counsellours of peace, is ioy.
There shall no euill happen to the iust: but the wicked shall bee filled with mischiefe.
Lying lippes are abomination to the Lord: but they that deale truely, are his delight.
A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fooles proclaimeth foolishnesse. Chap. 13. 16. & 15.2.
The hand of the diligent shall beare rule: but the slouthfull shall bee vnder tribute. Cha.10.4. , Or, deceitfull.
Heauinesse in the heart of man maketh it stoope: but a good word maketh it glad. Chap.15. 13.
The righteous is more excellent then his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them. Or, abundant.
The slouthfull man rosteth not that which he tooke in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
In the way of righteousnesse is life, and in the path-way thereof there is no death.
